component.name: Proton Authenticator
component.summary: Open-source, end-to-end encrypted authenticator for generating and syncing 2FA codes

developer.name: Proton AG
developer.address: Route de la Galaise 32, 1228 Plan-les-Ouates, Geneva, Switzerland

description.p: NOTE: This is a wrapper of the official packages, but it is not verified, affiliated with, or supported by Proton AG.

Proton Authenticator is an open-source, end-to-end encrypted two-factor authentication (2FA) app that generates one-time codes locally on your device and securely syncs them across platforms when you choose to.

Use Proton Authenticator to store and generate TOTP codes, import existing tokens, back up or sync securely across devices, lock the app with biometrics or a PIN, and access codes offline. A Proton Account is optional — syncing across non-Apple devices uses Proton’s encrypted sync; iCloud backup/sync is available for Apple users.

ul.li: Encrypted sync: End-to-end encryption for optional cross-device sync and backups.
Open source: Full source code is public for audit and verification.
No ads or tracking: No advertising, no trackers, and no data collection by default.
Platform availability: Android, iOS, Windows, macOS, Linux.
Import/export: Import tokens from other authenticators; export options available.
Offline use: Generate 2FA codes locally without an internet connection.
Biometric & PIN protection: Optional biometric unlock or PIN for extra security.
FIDO2 support: Support for additional security measures like FIDO2 where available.

ol.li: Download the app for your device.
Scan a website/app QR code or import existing tokens.
Use the generated 6-digit codes to complete 2FA during sign-in.

description.p: Proton Authenticator is built by the team behind Proton Mail and adheres to Swiss privacy and security standards.
